Name: Adelphi University
Description: Adelphi University, founded in 1896, is a private, coeducational institution. It is known for being a dotoral research university, with focus on the 'Core Four' areas of learning: arts and humanities; STEM and social sciences; business and education professions; and health and wellness. Its main 75-acre campus is in Garden City on Long Island, just 23 miles from New York City.

Name: Albany College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences
Description: Established in 1881, Albany College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences is a private independent specialized health care institution with campuses in Albany, New York, and Colchester, Vermont.

Name: Alfred State College
Description: SUNY College of Technology at Alfred, or Alfred State College, was founded as a school of agriculture in 1908, and was incorporated into the SUNY system in 1948. Today, the college offers a wide variety of majors, from welding to buisness, and focuses on hands-on instruction. Its 150-acre campus is located in Alfred, 75 miles south of Rochester, with a branch campus in Wellsville.

Name: Alfred University
Description: Alfred University is a private, coeducational institution. Its 600-acre campus is located in Alfred, 75 miles south of Rochester.

Name: Alliance University
Description: Alliance University, founded in 1882, is a private, Christian liberal arts college located in lower Manhattan.

Name: AMDA New York
Description: The American Musical and Dramatic Academy, founded in 1964, is a private two-year institution. Its campus is located in New York, NY.

Name: American Academy of Dramatic Arts
Description: American Academy of Dramatic Arts, founded in 1884, is a private specialized two-year institution. Its campus is located in New York, NY with a branch campus in Los Angeles.

Name: Apex Technical School
Description: Apex Technical School prepares students for career opportunities utilizing hands on technical training. The school has a rich tradition of service to New Yorkers since 1961 as a private school, licensed by the State of New York Education Department and accredited by the Accrediting Commission of Career Schools and Colleges.

Name: ASA College
Description: ASA College is a private, coeducational institution. Its campus is located in Brooklyn, NY.

Name: Atlantic Acting School
Description: Atlantic Acting School is a specialized institution. Its campus is located in New York.

Name: Bard College
Description: Bard College, founded in 1860, is a private, liberal arts college. Its 1,000-acre campus is located in Annandale-on-Hudson, 90 miles north of New York City.

Name: Barnard College
Description: Barnard College, founded in 1889, is a private, liberal arts college for women affiliated with Columbia University. Its four-acre campus is located in the Upper West Side of Manhattan.

Name: Baruch College, CUNY
Description: Founded in 1847, Bernard M. Baruch College of the City University of New York traces it roots to Free Academy. It is a public college located in the center of New York City's central business district.

Name: Berk Trade and Business School
Description: Berk Trade and Business School, founded in 1940, is a private, coeducational, technical/professional school. Its campus is located in Long Island City, New York.

Name: Berkeley College—New York
Description: Founded 1931, Berkeley College is a private coed institution. The main campus is located in mid-town Manhattan with additional locations in Brooklyn and White Plains, New York.  Programs also are available online.

Name: Binghamton University
Description: Binghamton University, founded in 1946, is a medium-sized, comprehensive, doctoral-granting university. Its 930-acre campus is located in Binghamton, NY, just three hours from New York City and Philadelphia, PA.

Name: Boricua College
Description: Boricua College, founded in 1974, is a private, liberal arts college with an English/Spanish bilingual and bicultural curriculum. Its campus is located in Manhattan.

Name: Borough of Manhattan Community College
Description: Borough of Manhattan Community College, founded in 1963, is a public two-year institution. Its campus is located in New York, NY.

Name: Bronx Community College
Description: Bronx Community College is a public, coeducational, two-year institution. Its campus is located in the Bronx, NY.

Name: Brooklyn College, CUNY
Description: Founded in 1930, Brooklyn College is a public liberal arts institution in the City University of New York school system. Its 26-acre campus is located in Brooklyn's Flatbush section.

Name: Buffalo State College
Description: Buffalo State, SUNY College at Buffalo, founded in 1867, is a public, multipurpose college of arts and sciences. Its 115-acre, urban campus is located in Buffalo.

Name: Canisius University
Description: Founded in 1870 by German Jesuits and named for St. Peter Canisius, Canisius University is the largest private university in Western New York. Its 72-acre campus is located in a residential neighborhood of North-Central Buffalo.

Name: Cayuga Community College
Description: Cayuga Community College, founded in 1953, is a public two-year institution. Its 50-acre campus is located in Auburn, NY.

Name: Charles Stuart School of Locksmithing
Description: Charles Stuart School of Locksmithing, founded in 1988, is a private two-year technical institution. Its campus is located in Brooklyn, NY.

Name: Cheryl Fells School of Business
Description: Cheryl Fells School of Business is a private two-year technical institution. Its campus is located in Niagara Falls, NY.

Name: Clarkson University
Description: Clarkson University is a private research university founded in 1896. Its 640-acre main campus is located in Potsdam, NY, with additional graduate programs and research facilities at its Capital Region Campus in Schenectady, NY, and its Beacon Institute for Rivers and Estuaries in Beacon, NY.

Name: Clinton Community College, SUNY
Description: Founded in 1969, Clinton Community College is a public two-year institution. Its 100-acre campus is located in Plattsburgh, NY.

Name: Colgate University
Description: Colgate University, founded in 1819, is a highly selective residential liberal arts institution. Its 550-acre campus is located in Hamilton, NY.

Name: College of Mount St. Vincent
Description: The College of Mount Saint Vincent is a co-educational, private, four-year college that provides an excellent liberal arts education in the Catholic tradition. Its 70-acre campus is located in the Riverdale section of the Bronx in New York City.

Name: Columbia University
Description: Founded in 1754, Columbia University is a private coeducational institution. Its 36-acre campus is located in New York City.

Name: Columbia–Greene Community College
Description: Columbia-Greene Community College, founded in 1966, is a public two-year institution. Its 144-acre campus is located in Hudson, NY.

Name: Commercial Driver Training
Description: Commercial Driver Training, founded in 1961, is a private vocational school specializing in driver training for tractor trailers, trucks, and buses. Its two-acre campus is located in West Babylon, NY.

Name: Cope Education for Business
Description: Cope Institute, founded in 1977, is a private, coeducational, technical/professional institution. Its campus is located in Brooklyn.

Name: Cornell University
Description: Cornell University, founded in 1865, is a private, not-for-profit, co-educational, nonsectarian institution of higher learning chartered and operated under Laws of the State of New York. Although a private institution, Cornell is also the land-grant institution for New York State. Its 745-acre campus is located in Ithaca, 52 miles from Syracuse.

Name: Cornell University Precollege Studies
Description: The mission of Cornell University Precollege Studies is to present the broadest possible range of high-quality learning opportunities to Cornell's many constituencies. The SCE draws on the resources of all of Cornell's academic units, identifying needs and developing programs that most appropriately and effectively deploy Cornell's vast and varied educational resources. Cornell faculty members are joined by leaders in industry, government, and the professions, along with distinguished scholars from other institutions, to present these programs throughout the year.

Name: D'Youville College
Description: D'Youville College is a private college. Founded as a women's college in 1908, it adopted coeducation in 1971. Its 17-acre campus is located less than a mile from the center of downtown Buffalo.

Name: Daemen University
Description: Daemen University, founded in 1947, is a small, private, comprehensive institution with a mixture of liberal arts and career programs. Daemen offers bachelor's, master's, and clinical doctorate degrees as well as a post-secondary certificate and post-baccalaureate and post-master's certificates. Its 35-acre campus is located in Amherst, New York—a suburb of Buffalo

Name: Davis College
Description: Davis College (formerly Practical Bible College), founded in 1900, is a private, faith-based, specialized school. Its 22-acre campus is located in Johnson City, NY, five miles from Binghamton and 70 miles from Syracuse.

Name: Dominican University, New York
Description: Founded in 1952, Dominican University in New York is a private non-affiliated liberal arts college offering undergraduate and graduate programs. Its 70-acre campus is located in Rockland County, 17 miles north of New York City.

Name: Downstate Health Sciences University
Description: SUNY Downstate Health Sciences University at Brooklyn, founded in 1858, is a public, upper-division institution. Its 13-acre campus is located in Brooklyn.

Name: Dutchess Community College
Description: Dutchess Community College, founded in 1957, is a public two-year institution. Its campus is located in Poughkeepsie, NY.

Name: Dutchess Community College South
Description: Dutchess Community College South is a public two-year institution. Its campus is located in Wappingers Falls, NY.

Name: Eastman School of Music
Description: Eastman School of Music, founded in 1921, is a private music conservatory within the University of Rochester. Its campus is located in Rochester, NY.

Name: Elmira Business Institute
Description: Elmira Business Institute, founded in 1858, is a private, coeducational, two-year institution. Its campus is located in Elmira, New York.

Name: Elmira College
Description: Elmira College, steeped in tradition, is a private, residential, co-educational liberal arts college that emphasizes both general and professional education.  Founded as a women's college in 1855, it adopted coeducation in 1969. Its 55-acre campus is located in a residential area of Elmira, NY.

Name: Empire Beauty School (New York)
Description: Empire Beauty Schools offer cosmetology programs at 96 locations across 20 states. Other programs such as nail technology and esthetics are available at select locations.

Name: Erie Community College—City Campus
Description: Founded in 1971, Erie Community College—City Campus is a public two-year liberal arts college. Its campus is located in Buffalo, New York.

Name: Erie Community College—North Campus
Description: Founded in 1946, Erie Community College—North Campus is a public two-year liberal arts college. Its 120-acre campus is located in Williamsville, New York.

Name: Erie Community College—South Campus
Description: Founded in 1974, Erie Community College—South Campus is a public two-year institution. Its campus is located in Orchard Park, NY.

Name: Eugene Lang College of Liberal Arts at The New School
Description: Founded in 1985, Eugene Lang College of Liberal Arts at The New School is a private coeducational institution. Its five-acre, urban campus is located in the Greenwich Village area of New York City

Name: Excelsior College
Description: Founded in 1971, Excelsior College provides innovative and rigorous distance learning academic programs to adult learners. Accredited by Middle States, Excelsior offers 58 undergraduate and 3 graduate degree. Excelsior serves over 30,000 enrolled students in both its assessment and instruction based programs.

Name: Farmingdale State College
Description: Farmingdale State College, founded in 1912, is a public college of technology and applied sciences. Its 380-acre campus is located in Farmingdale on Long Island, 35 miles from New York City.

Name: Fashion Institute of Technology
Description: The Fashion Institute of Technology, founded in 1944, is a school of art and design and business and technology. It is a public institution, receiving its principal financial support from the State and City of New York. Its five-acre campus is located in midtown Manhattan, near the center of New York's fashion industry.

Name: Finger Lakes Community College
Description: Finger Lakes Community College, founded in 1965, is a public, coeducational, two-year institution. Its campus is located in Canandaigua, NY.

Name: Five Towns College
Description: Five Town College, founded in 1972, is a private coeducational institution. Its 35-acre campus is located in Dix Hills, 25 miles from New York City.

Name: Fordham University
Description: Fordham University is the Jesuit University of New York.  Founded in 1841, our  85-acre Rose Hill campus is located in the Bronx, adjacent to the Botanical Gardens and Bronx Zoo. Our eight-acre Lincoln Center campus is located in Manhattan, right next to the Lincoln Center arts complex.

Name: Fulton–Montgomery Community College
Description: Founded in 1963, Fulton-Montgomery Community College,  is a public two-year coeducational institution. Its campus is located in Johnstown, NY.

Name: Gemological Institute of America New York
Description: Gemological Institute of America, founded in 1931, is a private two-year professional institution. Its campus is located in New York, NY.

Name: Genesee Community College
Description: Genesee Community College, founded in 1966, is a public, two-year, liberal arts institution. Its 250-acre campus is located in Batavia, NY.

Name: Guttman Community College
Description: Guttman Community College is a public liberal arts community college in New York City. It's the newest of the City University of New York (CUNY) school system community colleges and was founded in September of 2012.

Name: Hamilton College
Description: Hamilton College is a private, liberal arts college. Founded in 1812, it adopted coeducation in 1978. Its 1,300-acre campus is located in Clinton, nine miles from Utica.

Name: Harlem School of Technology
Description: Harlem School of Technology is a private, two-year technical institution. Its campus is located in New York, NY.

Name: Hartwick College
Description: Hartwick College, founded in 1797, is a private liberal arts and sciences college. The 425-acre campus is located in Oneonta, New York.

Name: Helene Fuld College of Nursing
Description: Helen Fuld College of Nursing, founded in 1945, is a private, specialized institution. Its campus is located in New York.

Name: Herkimer County Community College
Description: Herkimer County Community College, founded in 1967, is a public two-year institution. Its 500-acre campus is located in Herkimer, NY.

Name: Hilbert College
Description: Hilbert College is a private, Catholic, Franciscan college. Founded in 1957, it adopted coeducation in 1969. Its 49-acre campus is located in the town of Hamburg, 10 miles from Buffalo.

Name: Hobart and William Smith Colleges
Description: Hobart College, founded in 1822, is a private liberal arts college for men. Coordinate college, William Smith, founded in 1908, is a private liberal arts college for women. Its 200-acre combined campus is located in Geneva.

Name: Hofstra University
Description: Hofstra University, founded in 1935, is a private university. Its 240-acre campus is located in Hempstead, 25 miles east of New York City.

Name: Hostos Community College
Description: Hostos Community College, founded in 1968, is a public, specialized, coeducational institution. Its campus is located in Bronx, NY.

Name: Houghton University
Description: Founded in 1883, Houghton University is a private coeducational Christian institution of the liberal arts and sciences. Its 1,300-acre campus is located in Houghton, NY, 60 miles from Buffalo and 70 miles from Rochester.

Name: Hudson Valley Community College
Description: Hudson Valley Community College, founded in 1953, is a public two-year institution. Its 154-acre campus is located in Troy, NY.

Name: Hunter Business School
Description: Hunter Business School is a private, two-year, professional institution. Its campus is located in Levittown, NY.

Name: Hunter College, CUNY
Description: Founded in 1870, Hunter College is a public institution and part of the City University of New York system. Its three-block campus is located in New York City.

Name: Iona University
Description: Iona University is a coeducational Roman Catholic liberal arts institution founded in 1940 in the tradition of the Christian Brothers. Programs are offered through the Schools of Arts and Sciences and Business. Its 45-acre campus is located in New Rochelle on Long Island Sound, 16 miles from New York City.

Name: Island Drafting & Technical Institute
Description: Island Drafting and Technical Institute, founded in 1957, is a private, technical institute specializing in computer aided drafting/design technology. Its campus is located in Amityville, New York.

Name: Ithaca College
Description: Founded in 1892, Ithaca College is a private liberal arts college with programs offered through the Schools of Business, Communications, Health Sciences & Human Performance, Humanities & Sciences, and Music. Its 670-contiguous-acre campus is located in Ithaca, New York—50 miles south of Syracuse.

Name: Jamestown Business College
Description: Jamestown Business College, founded in 1886, is a private two-year institution. Its campus is located in Jamestown, NY.

Name: Jamestown Community College
Description: Founded in 1950, Jamestown Community College is a public, two-year college. The main campus is located on a 107-acre site at the foot of Chautauqua Lake in Jamestown, NY. JCC has a branch campus in Olean, NY and extension centers in Dunkirk, NY and Warren, PA. Jamestown Community College is part of the State University of New York (SUNY) system.

Name: Jamestown Community College—Cattaraugus County Campus
Description: Founded in 1950, Jamestown Community College,  is a public two-year college. The main campus is located on a 107-acre site at the foot of Chautauqua Lake in Jamestown, New York. JCC has a branch campus in Olean and extension centers in Dunkirk and Warren, Pennsylvania. Jamestown Community College is part of the State University of New York (SUNY) system.

Name: Jamestown Community College—North County Center
Description: Founded in 1950, Jamestown Community College is a public two-year college. The main campus is located on a 107-acre site at the foot of Chautauqua Lake in Jamestown, New York. JCC has a branch campus in Olean and extension centers in Dunkirk and Warren, Pennsylvania. Jamestown Community College is part of the State University of New York (SUNY) system.

Name: Jefferson Community College
Description: Jefferson Community College, part of the SUNY college system, founded in 1962, is a public, coeducational, two-year institution. Its campus is located in Watertown, NY.

Name: Jewish Theological Seminary of America
Description: The Jewish Theological Seminary, founded in 1886, is a private, coeducational Conservative Judaistic college. Its campus is located in New York City.

Name: Joffrey Ballet School
Description: American Ballet Center/Joffrey Ballet School, founded in 1952, is a private, specialized, coeducational institution. Its campus is located in New York.

Name: John Jay College of Criminal Justice
Description: John Jay College of Criminal Justice is a public institution of liberal arts and criminal justice and a senior member of the City University of New York school system. Founded in 1964, it grew out of a program of higher education for New York City police officers. Its campus is located in the Lincoln Center area of Manhattan.

Name: Juilliard School
Description: The Juilliard School, founded in 1905, is a private conservatory of the performing arts. Its campus is located at Lincoln Center in New York City.

Name: Keuka College
Description: Keuka College, founded in 1890, is a private, liberal arts institution. Its 288-acre campus is located in  Keuka Park, 50 miles from Rochester.

Name: Kingsborough Community College
Description: Kingsborough Community College, founded in 1963, is a public, coeducational institution. Its campus is located in Brooklyn, New York.

Name: LaGuardia Community College
Description: LaGuardia Community College, founded in 1971, is a public, two-year, liberal arts institution. Its 6-acre campus is located in Long Island City, NY.

Name: Le Moyne College
Description: Le Moyne College, founded in 1946, is a liberal arts college in the Catholic, Jesuit tradition. Its 161-acre campus is located in a residential area, minutes from downtown Syracuse.

Name: Lehman College, CUNY
Description: Founded in 1931, Lehman College is a public liberal arts institution that was initially a branch campus of Hunter College; it became a separate CUNY college in 1968. Its 37-acre campus is located in the Bronx.

Name: LIM College
Description: LIM College, founded in 1939, is a private, fashion and business centered institution. Its facilities are located in Midown Manhattan.

Name: Long Island Business Institute
Description: Long Island Business Institute, founded in 1968, is a private two-year institution. Its 1-acre campus is located in Commack, NY.

Name: Long Island University—Brooklyn Campus
Description: Founded in 1926, Long Island University in Brooklyn is a private institution. Its 11-acre campus is located in downtown Brooklyn, NY.

Name: Long Island University—C.W. Post Campus
Description: Founded in 1954, Long Island University C.W. Post Campus is a private institution. Its 322-acre campus is located in Brookville, 45 minutes from Manhattan.

Name: Mandl School
Description: Mandl School, founded in 1924, is a private, two-year, technical institution. Its campus is located in New York, NY.

Name: Manhattan College
Description: Manhattan College, established in 1853, is a private, four-year, coeducational, Lasallian Catholic institution of higher learning. Its 22-acre campus is located in the Riverdale section of the Bronx in New York City.

Name: Manhattan School of Computer Technology
Description: Manhattan School of Computer Technology is a private two-year institution. Its campus is located in New York, NY.

Name: Manhattan School of Music
Description: The Manhattan School of Music, founded in 1917, is a private institution. Its facilities are located in the Morningside Heights section of Manhattan.

Name: Manhattanville University
Description: Founded 1841, Manhattanville University is a private coeducational liberal arts institution with a mission to educate students to be ethical and socially-responsible leaders in a global community. Its 100-acre campus is located in Purchase, New York—approximately 25 miles from New York City.

Name: Maria College of Albany
Description: Maria College of Albany, founded in 1958, is a private two-year institution. Its campus is located in Albany, NY.

Name: Marist College
Description: Marist College, founded in 1929, is a private, independent, comprehensive institution grounded in the liberal arts, located on a 210-acre campus in New York's Hudson River Valley, with a branch campus abroad in Florence, Italy.

Name: Martha Graham School Contemporary Dance
Description: Martha Graham School of Contemporary Dance, founded in 1926, is a private, two-year, dance institution. Its campus is located in New York, NY.

Name: Marymount Manhattan College
Description: Marymount Manhattan College, founded in 1936, is a private, liberal arts college. Founded as a branch of Marymount College of Tarrytown, NY, it became an independent institution in 1961. Its one-acre campus is located in midtown Manhattan.

Name: Medgar Evers College, CUNY
Description: Founded in 1970, Medgar Evers College is a public liberal arts institution. Its a seven-acre campus located in the Central Brooklyn area.

Name: Mercy University
Description: Since 1950, Mercy University has been on a mission, bringing education to students in new ways, and making it our business to empower generations of learners. We help students break new ground, achieve forward momentum and create lasting impact that ripples beyond themselves, to their families and communities.

Name: Metropolitan College of New York
Description: Founded in 1964, Metropolitan College of New York is a private non-profit college offering business, education, human services, urban studies, and public affairs programs. Its campus is located in Manhattan.

Name: Mildred Elley (New York)
Description: Mildred Elley is a private, coeducational institution. Its campus is located in Albany, New York.

Name: Modern Welding School
Description: Modern Welding School, founded in 1936, is a private, two-year, technical institution. Its 1-acre campus is located in Schenectady, NY.

Name: Mohawk Valley Community College
Description: Mohawk Valley Community College, founded in 1946, is New York State's oldest community college.  MVCC is one of 30 public community colleges in the State University of New York system.  The main 80-acre campus is located in Utica; a branch campus is located in nearby Rome, NY.

Name: Molloy University
Description: Molloy University, founded in 1955, is a private, church-affiliated, liberal arts college. Its 30-acre campus is located in Rockville Centre, 25 miles east of New York City.

Name: Monroe College — New Rochelle Campus
Description: Monroe College -- New Rochelle Campus is a public, coeducational institution. Its campus is located in New Rochelle, New York.

Name: Monroe College
Description: Monroe College, founded in 1933, is a private institution. Its campus is located in the Bronx, NY.

Name: Monroe Community College
Description: Monroe Community College, founded in 1961, is a public, two-year institution. Its three-acre campus is located in Rochester, New York.

Name: Mount Saint Mary College
Description: Mount Saint Mary College is a private liberal arts college. Founded in 1959, it adopted coeducation in 1968. Its 86-acre campus is located in Newburgh, 58 miles north of New York City.

Name: Music Conservatory of Westchester
Description: Music Conservatory of Westchester, founded in 1929, is a private two-year institution. Its campus is located in White Plains, NY.

Name: Nassau Community College
Description: Nassau Community College, founded in 1960, is a public, two-year, liberal arts institution. Its 225-acre campus is located in Garden City, NY.

Name: National Tractor Trailer School — Buffalo
Description: National Tractor Trailer School, founded in 1989, is a private, two-year, technical institution. Its 11-acre campus is located in Buffalo, NY.

Name: National Tractor Trailer School — Liverpool
Description: National Tractor Trailer School, founded in 1971, is a private, two-year, technical institution. Its seven-acre campus is located in Liverpool, NY.

Name: Nazareth College
Description: Nazareth College, founded in 1924, is a coeducational college with undergraduate and graduate studies in liberal arts and sciences and professional programs in health and human services, education, and management. Its 150-acre campus is located in Rochester, New York.

Name: New York City College of Technology
Description: Founded in 1946, New York City College of Technology is a public specialized tech institution in the City University of New York school system. Its campus is located in Brooklyn.

Name: New York Film Academy
Description: New York Film Academy, founded in 1992, is a two-year specialized institution. Its campus is located in New York, NY. The school has two other campuses in Los Angeles and South Beach, Florida. The Los Angeles campus offers additional Bachelor's and Master's programs.

Name: New York Institute of Technology
Description: New York Institute of Technology, founded in 1955, is a private, non-profit institution with campuses on Long Island in Old Westbury, NY; in Manhattan; Jonesboro, Arkansas; Abu Dhabi, the United Arab Emirates; Vancouver, Canada; and China.

Name: New York Paralegal School
Description: New York Paralegal School is a private specialized institution. Its campus is located in New York, NY.

Name: New York School for Medical and Dental Assistants
Description: New York School for Medical and Dental Assistants, founded in 1966, is a private, specialized, coeducational, technical/professional institution. Its campus is located in Long Island City, Queens, New York.

Name: New York School of Interior Design
Description: The New York School of Interior Design, founded in 1916, is a private, primarily specialized institute. Its campus is located on Manhattan's upper east side in New York City.

Name: New York University
Description: Founded in 1831, New York University is one of the largest private universities in the United States. Programs are offered through 18 schools and colleges at five major centers in Manhattan and in sites in Africa, Asia, Europe, and South America. The faculty's research and teaching encompass the humanities, sciences, and social sciences; law; medicine; business; education; fine arts, studio art, and performing and cinematic arts; music; social work; public administration; the ancient world; and continuing and professional studies. NYU's main campus is located in the heart of Greenwich Village in New York City, with an additional location in Brooklyn.

Name: Niagara County Community College
Description: Niagara County Community College, founded in 1962, is a public two-year institution. Its 287-acre campus is located in Sanborn, NY.

Name: Niagara University
Description: Niagara University, founded by the Vincentian community in 1856, is a comprehensive institution, blending the best of a liberal arts and professional education, grounded in a values-based, Catholic tradition. Its 160-acre campus is located four miles from Niagara Falls, 20 minutes from Buffalo, and 90 minutes from Toronto.

Name: North Country Community College
Description: North Country Community College, founded in 1967, is a public, coeducational, two-year institution. Its 70-acre campus is located in Saranac Lake, seven miles from Lake Placid and 40 miles from Plattsburgh.

Name: North Country Community College—Ticonderoga Campus
Description: North Country Community College is a public two-year institution. Its branch campus is in Ticonderoga, New York, and the main campus is in Saranac Lake.

Name: Onondaga Community College
Description: Onondaga Community College, founded in 1962, is a public college. Its 230-acre campus is located in Syracuse.

Name: Orange County Community College
Description: Orange County Community College, founded in 1950, is a public, two-year, liberal arts institution. Its 37-acre campus is located in Middletown, NY.

Name: Pace University
Description: Pace University, founded in 1906, is a private, comprehensive university. Its three-acre urban campus is located in New York City and its 200-acre suburban campus is located in Pleasantville-Briarcliff, 20 miles from New York City.

Name: Pace University—Westchester
Description: Founded in 1906, Pace University is a private comprehensive university. Its three-acre urban campus is located in New York City and its 200-acre suburban campus is located in Pleasantville-Briarcliff, 20 miles from New York City.

Name: Parsons School of Design at The New School
Description: Founded in 1896 and affiliated with The New School in 1970, Parsons School of Design is a private coeducational school of the arts. Its campus is located in New York City.

Name: Paul Smith's College
Description: Paul Smith's College, founded in 1937, is a private, specialized institution. Its 14,200-acre wilderness campus is located in Paul Smith's, New York.

Name: Plaza College
Description: Plaza College, founded in 1916, is a private two-year institution. Its campus is located in Forest Hills, NY.

Name: Pratt Institute
Description: Pratt Institute, founded in 1887, is a private, multipurpose institute. Programs are offered through the Schools of Architecture and Art and Design. Its 25-acre campus is located in Brooklyn.

Name: PrattMWP College of Art and Design
Description: Pratt at Munson Williams Proctor Arts Institute, founded in 1919, is a small art college offering the first two years of a bachelor's degree with the last two years at the Pratt Institute in Brooklyn, NY. Its campus is located in Utica, NY.

Name: Purchase College
Description: Purchase College, SUNY, founded in 1967, is a public college and part of the State University of New York system. Located 25 miles north of Manhattan in Westchester County, the campus sits on a 500-plus acre estate and offers programs in the School of the Arts, the School of Liberal Arts and Sciences, and the School of Liberal Studies and Continuing Education.

Name: Queens College, CUNY
Description: Founded in 1937, Queens College is a public coeducational liberal arts institution in the City University of New York school system. Its 80-acre campus is located in the Flushing section of Queens in New York.

Name: Queensborough Community College
Description: Queensborough Community College, founded in 1959, is a public two-year institution. Its 34-acre campus is located in Bayside, NY.

Name: Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute
Description: Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, founded in 1824, is a private, technical institution. Programs are offered through the Schools of Architecture, Engineering, Humanities Arts & Social Sciences, Management, and Science. Its 260-acre campus is located in Troy, 15 miles from Albany.

Name: Roberts Wesleyan College
Description: Founded in 1866, Roberts Wesleyan College is a private Christian liberal arts college. Its 188-acre campus is located eight miles from downtown Rochester.

Name: Rochester Institute of Technology
Description: Rochester Institute of Technology, founded in 1829, is a private, coeducational institution. Its 1,300-acre campus is located in Rochester, 75 miles from Buffalo and 97 miles from Syracuse, with branch campuses abroad in China, Croatia, Dubai, and Kosovo.

Name: Rockland Community College
Description: Rockland Community College, founded in 1959, is a public two-year institution. Its 120-acre campus is located in Suffern, NY.

Name: Russell Sage College
Description: Russell Sage College (formerly The Sage Colleges), is a four-year college  specializing in the arts and sciences and professional fields of study with two campuses in Troy and Albany, NY. Both campuses offer both undergraduate and graduate degree programs and courses.

Name: SAGE Truck Driving School — New York
Samaritan Hospital School of Nursing
Description: Samaritan Hospital School of Nursing, founded in 1898, is a private two-year institution.

Name: Sarah Lawrence College
Description: Sarah Lawrence College, founded in 1926, is a private, coeducational, liberal arts college. Its campus is located in Bronxville, New York.

Name: Schenectady County Community College
Description: Schenectady County Community College, founded in 1968, is a public two-year institution. Its 50-acre campus is located in Schenectady, NY.

Name: School of Visual Arts
Description: The School of Visual Arts, founded in 1947, is a private school of art. Its campus of 18 buildings is located in lower Manhattan.

Name: Siena College
Description: Siena College, founded in 1937, is an independent, liberal arts college with a Franciscan and Catholic tradition. Programs are offered through the Schools of Liberal Arts, Business, and Science.  Its 175-acre campus is located in Loudonville, 15-miles north of Albany.

Name: Skidmore College
Description: Skidmore College is a private, liberal arts college. Founded in 1903, it adopted coeducation in 1971. Its 890-acre campus is located in Saratoga Springs, 30 miles from Albany.

Name: Spanish–American Institute
Description: Spanish-American Institute, founded in 1955, is a private two-year institution. Its campus is located in New York, NY.

Name: St. Bonaventure University
Description: St. Bonaventure University, founded in 1858, is a private, coeducational  institution. Its 600-acre campus is located in Olean, 75 miles from Buffalo.

Name: St. Francis College
Description: St. Francis College is a private, church-affiliated, liberal arts college. Founded in 1884 with the purpose of providing higher education for students with limited economic resources, it adopted coeducation in 1969. Its urban campus is located in Brooklyn Heights.

Name: St. John Fisher College
Description: St. John Fisher College is a coeducational liberal arts college located in Pittsford, New York. Its 154-acre campus is located in Rochester.

Name: St. John's University
Description: St. John's University, founded in 1870, is a private, Roman Catholic university. Its 102-acre main campus is located in the Jamaica section of Queens in New York City.

Name: St. Joseph's University—Brooklyn
Description: St. Joseph's University (formerly College) in Brooklyn is a private Catholic liberal arts institution. Founded as a women's college in 1916, it adopted coeducation in 1969. Its five-acre campus is located in a residential section of Brooklyn, 5 miles from Midtown Manhattan.

Name: St. Joseph's University—Long Island
Description: Founded in 1916, St. Joseph's University (formerly College) on Long Island is a private Catholic liberal arts institution. Its 56-acre campus is located in Patchoque, 55 miles from midtown Manhattan.

Name: St. Lawrence University
Description: St. Lawrence University, founded in 1856, is a private, liberal arts university. Its 1,000-acre campus is located in Canton, in northern New York.

Name: St. Thomas Aquinas College
Description: St. Thomas Aquinas College is a private, liberal arts college. Founded in 1952, it adopted coeducation in 1968. Its 43-acre campus is located in Sparkill, 15 miles from New York City.

Name: Stony Brook University
Description: Stony Brook University, State University of New York, founded in 1957, is a public research university. Its 1,040-acre campus is located on the North Shore of Long Island, 60 miles east of New York City

Name: Studio Jewelers, Ltd.
Description: Studio Jewelers, Ltd. founded in 1979, is a jewelry trade school, located in New York.

Name: Suffolk County Community College—Ammerman Campus
Description: Suffolk County Community College is a public two-year institution with three campuses in Selden, Brentwood, and Riverhead, New York.

Name: Suffolk County Community College—Eastern Campus
Description: Suffolk County Community College is a public two-year institution with three campuses in Riverhead,  Brentwood, and Selden, New York.

Name: Suffolk County Community College—Grant Campus
Description: Suffolk County Community College is a public two-year institution with three campuses in Brentwood, Riverhead, and Selden, New York.

Name: SUNY Adirondack
Description: Founded in 1961, SUNY Adirondack is a public community liberal arts college. Its campus is located in Queensbury, New York.

Name: SUNY Brockport
Description: SUNY Brockport, founded in 1835, is a public, comprehensive four-year college. Its 464-acre campus is located in Brockport, NY: 16 miles west of Rochester, NY, 45 miles east of Buffalo, NY, and a short drive from the Canadian border.

Name: SUNY Broome Community College
Description: Broome Community College is a public, comprehensive community college supervised the the State University of New York, sponsored by the County of Broome, and governed by a Board of Trustees. Chartered in 1946 Broome Community College's 220-acre campus is located in BInghamton, New York.

Name: SUNY Canton
Description: Founded in 1906, SUNY Canton is a public coeducational residential college located on a 555-acre campus along the banks of the Grasse River in Canton, New York.

Name: SUNY Cobleskill
Description: Founded in 1911, SUNY Cobleskill is a public polytechnic college with a rich academic tradition spanning over 100 years. Over 2,300 students are enrolled in the 58 certificate, associate, and baccalaureate degree programs offered.  Its 902-acre campus is located in Cobleskill, 35 miles from Albany.

Name: SUNY College of Environmental Science and Forestry
Description: SUNY College of Environmental Science and Forestry, founded in 1911, is a public, multipurpose college. Its 12-acre campus is located in Syracuse.

Name: SUNY Corning Community College
Description: Corning Community College, founded in 1956, is a public, coeducational, two-year institution. Its campus is located in Corning, NY.

Name: SUNY Cortland
Description: SUNY Cortland, founded in 1868, is a public, multipurpose college of arts and sciences. Its 191-acre campus is located in Cortland, 30 miles from Syracuse.

Name: SUNY Delhi
Description: SUNY--Delhi, founded in 1913, is a public, coeducational institution offering degrees ranging from the Certificate to Master's level.  Its campus is located in Delhi, New York.

Name: SUNY Empire State College
Description: SUNY Empire State College, founded in 1971, is a public, coeducational institution. Its campus is located in Saratoga Springs, New York.

Name: SUNY Fredonia
Description: State University of New York at Fredonia is a public comprehensive selective liberal arts university in western New York, just minutes from Lake Erie. Founded in 1826, the university is among the oldest in the SUNY system.

Name: SUNY Geneseo
Description: SUNY Geneseo, founded in 1871, is a public, multipurpose college of liberal arts and sciences. Its 220-acre campus is located in Geneseo, NY, 30 miles south of Rochester.

Name: SUNY Maritime College
Description: SUNY Maritime College, founded in 1874, is a public, multipurpose college for the maritime and related industries. Its 56-acre campus is located in Throggs Neck.

Name: SUNY Morrisville
Description: SUNY Morrisville, founded in 1908, is a public, coeducational institution. Its campus is located in Morrisville, NY.

Name: SUNY New Paltz
Description: Founded in 1828, SUNY New Paltz is a public multipurpose institution of arts and sciences. Its 216-acre campus is located in New Paltz, 75 miles from Albany.

Name: SUNY Old Westbury
Description: SUNY College at Old Westbury, founded in 1965, is a comprehensive public college offering undergraduate and graduate degrees. With a wooded 604-acre campus centrally located on Long Island, the nation's 17th largest population center, Old Westbury offers the best of both worlds -- a quiet atmosphere dedicated to learning, yet just 20 miles from the heart of New York City.

Name: SUNY Oneonta
Description: SUNY Oneonta, founded in 1889, is a public, multipurpose university of liberal arts and sciences. Its 250-acre campus is located in Oneonta, 75 miles southwest of Albany.

Name: SUNY Oswego
Description: SUNY Oswego, founded in 1861, is a public, multipurpose college of arts and sciences. Its 696-acre campus is located in Oswego, 35 miles northwest of Syracuse, on the shore of Lake Ontario.

Name: SUNY Plattsburgh
Description: SUNY Plattsburgh, founded in 1889, is a public, multipurpose college of arts and sciences. Its 300-acre campus is located in Plattsburgh, 60 miles from Montreal, Canada.

Name: SUNY Polytechnic Institute
Description: SUNY Polytechnic Institute, founded in 1966, is a public institute of technology. It has campuses in Utica and Albany, New York.

Name: SUNY Potsdam
Description: SUNY Potsdam, founded in 1816, is a public, liberal arts college. Its 240-acre campus is located in Potsdam NY, north of Syracuse.

Name: SUNY Sullivan
Description: Sullivan County Community College, founded in 1963, is a public two-year institution. Its 405-acre campus is located in Loch Sheldrake, NY.

Name: SUNY Ulster
Description: SUNY Ulster is a public two-year institution. Its campus is located in Stone Ridge, NY.

Name: SUNY Upstate Medical University
Description: SUNY Upstate Medical University, founded in 1950, is a public, comprehensive institution. Its 30-acre campus is located in downtown Syracuse.

Name: Syracuse University
Description: Syracuse University, founded in 1870, is a private, coeducational institution. Its 708-acre campus is located in Syracuse.  The University's original colors were pink and pea green. Orange became the official color in 1890.

Name: The City College of New York, CUNY
Description: Founded in 1847 as the Free Academy, the City College of New York is a public institution and the first of City University of New York schools. Programs are offered through the College of Liberal Arts and Science and the Schools of Architecture, Education, and Engineering, and the Division of the Arts. Its 35-acre campus of Gothic and modern architecture is located in New York's St. Nicholas Heights section.

Name: The College of Saint Rose
Description: The College of Saint Rose, founded in 1920, is a private, independent, coeducational institution of higher education offering more than 100 bachelor's, master's, and certificate degree programs. The College serves undergraduate and graduate students, working professionals, international students, and more. Its 49-acre campus is located in Albany, New York.

Name: The College of Staten Island, CUNY
Description: Formed in 1976 through the merger of Staten Island Community College and Richmond College, The College of Staten Island is a public liberal arts college. Its 204-acre campus is located in Staten Island, a borough of New York City.

Name: The College of Westchester
Description: The College of Westchester, founded in 1915, is a coeducation, private college providing students with an education in diverse community and preparing them for professional careers. It's campus is located in White Plains, New York.

Name: The Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art
Description: The Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art, founded in 1859, is a private, multipurpose institution located in lower Manhattan.

Name: The Culinary Institute of America at Hyde Park
Description: The Culinary Institute of America (CIA), founded in 1946, is an independent, non-profit, specialized college. Its 172-acre main campus is located in New York (Hyde Park).

Name: The King's College
Description: The King's College, founded in 1938 and reorganized in 1999, is a private Christian college. Its campus is located in New York.

Name: The New School Center for Media
Description: The New School Center for Media (formerly The New School of Radio and Television), is a private, specialized institution. Its campus is located in Albany.

Name: The New School College of Performing Arts
Description: The New School College of Performing Arts is a private coeducational institution that consists of three schools: the Mannes School of Music, the School of Drama, and the School of Jazz & Contemporary Music. Its campus is located in New York City.

Name: The New School for Public Engagement
Description: The New School for Public Engagement, founded in 1919, is a private, coeducational institution. Its campus is located in New York.

Name: The New York Conservatory for Dramatic Arts School of Film and Television
Description: The New York Conservatory for Dramatic Arts is an institutionally accredited member of The National Association of Schools of Theatre (NAST), located in the heart of New York City.

Name: The State University of New York Recruitment Response Center
Description: The State University of New York, SUNY for short, university system is home to 64 colleges across the state of New York. It's university system administration building is located in Albany.

Name: Tompkins Cortland Community College
Description: Founded in 1968, Tompkins Cortland Community College is a public two-year liberal arts institution. Its 220-acre campus is located in Dryden, NY.

Name: Touro College
Description: Touro College in New York, founded in 1971, is a private college part of the Touro College and University System, the largest not-for-profit independent institution of higher and professional education under Jewish auspices in the country. Its urban campus is located in downtown Manhattan.

Name: Trocaire College
Description: Trocaire College, founded in 1958, is a private, two-year, coeducational institution. Its campus is located in Buffalo, New York.

Name: Union College
Description: Union College, founded in 1795 and the first college chartered by the New York State Board of Regents, offers programs in the liberal arts and engineering. Union's curriculum emphasizes collaboration with students and faculty through small classes and undergraduate research, an international experience in all disciplines and learning through service to the campus and community.  Located in the city of Schenectady, Union's campus is three hours from New York City and Boston.

Name: United States Merchant Marine Academy
Description: The U.S. Merchant Marine Academy is a federal academy. Founded in 1943, it adopted coeducation in 1974. Its 80-acre campus is located in Kings Point, on the north shore of Long Island, 20 miles east of mid-town New York City.

Name: United States Military Academy
Description: Founded in 1802, United States Military Academy is a fully funded four year college specifically charge with educating, training, and inspiring young men and women for service as commissioned officers in the US Army.  West Point is a picturesque 16,080-acre campus along the Hudson River in Orange County, New York.

Name: University at Albany
Description: Founded in 1844, University at Albany is a public comprehensive research institution in the Capital Region of New York. Its 560-acre Uptown Campus is located in Albany.

Name: University at Buffalo
Description: SUNY University at Buffalo, founded in 1846, is a public, coeducational institution. Its 1,350-acre campus is located in Buffalo, New York.

Name: University of Rochester
Description: The University of Rochester, founded in 1850, is a private, coeducational research university. Its 655-acre campus is located in Rochester, NY.

Name: Utica College
Description: Utica College, founded in 1946, is a comprehensive, independent, private institution. Its 128-acre campus is located in Utica, 50 miles from Syracuse.

Name: Vassar College
Description: Vassar College is a private, liberal arts college. Founded for women in 1861, it adopted coeducation in 1969. Its 1,000-acre campus is located on the outskirts of Poughkeepsie, 75 miles north of New York City. It includes a range of architecture from Gothic to modernist.

Name: Vaughn College of Aeronautics and Technology
Description: Vaughn College of Aeronautics and Technology, founded in 1932, is a private, coeducational, four-year, specialized institution. Its campus is located in Flushing, New York.

Name: Villa Maria College
Description: Villa Maria College is a private, co-educational institution of higher education offering both associate and bachelor's degrees, emphasizing programs in the applied arts and music while offering and maintaining quality programs in other educational disciplines.  The college was established in 1961 and is located in the town of Cheektowaga, which borders the eastern edge of the city of Buffalo, NY.

Name: Wagner College
Description: Founded in 1883, Wagner College is a four-year liberal arts college. Its 110-acre campus is located on Staten Island.

Name: Webb Institute
Description: Webb Institute is a private institute of naval architecture and marine engineering. Founded in 1889, it adopted coeducation in 1974. Its 26-acre campus is located in Glen Cove, on the north shore of Long Island, 22 miles from New York City.

Name: Wells College
Description: Wells College, founded in 1868, is a private, coeducational, liberal arts college. Its 365-acre campus is located in Aurora, New York on the eastern shore of stunning Cayuga Lake.

Name: Westchester Community College
Description: Westchester Community College, founded in 1946 is a public two year college. Its 218-acre campus is located in Valhalla, Westchester County in New York State.

Name: Wilson Technological Center
Description: Wilson Technological Center, a division of Western Suffolk BOCES, is a public, coeducational, technical/professional institution. Its campus is located in Dix Hills, New York.

Name: Yeshiva University
Description: Yeshiva University, founded in 1886, is a private, comprehensive university. Its facilities are located at three centers in Manhattan and one in the Bronx.

Name: York College, CUNY
Description: Founded in 1966, York College is a public institution offering liberal arts and career education and is a member of the City University of New York school system. Its 50-acre campus is located in Jamaica.
